2. Create a java project

4. Open this class in a java editor

6. Start eclipse 3.3M5 using the 3.1.2 workspace

Sorry, something is strange here. This seams to have nothing to do with old workspaces. It happens every time I open the workspace with my workbench runtime but not if I open it with I20070206-0010. Steps are:

1. Start runtime workbench with HEAD on fresh workspace
2. Create a new java project
3. create a new java class
4. Open class in editor
5. Restart runtime workbench
Is:
 Exceptions are thrown

Uuuf, ok, this is bad. It it is related to old workspaces:

1. Create a new workspace with eclipse 3.1.2
2. Create a java project
3. Create a java class
4. Open this class in a java editor
5. Close eclipse
6. Start eclipse 3.3M5 using the 3.1.2 workspace
Is:
 Exceptions are thrown every time you start 3.3M5 and editors are not restored which makes old workspaces basically unusable.
Markus: same kind of problem, yes.
Missed a part of the startup procedure that needs to be on the UI thread.   Patch forthcoming.

Created an attachment (id=58342)
Patch against org.eclipse.ui.workbench
Fix in HEAD.  Thanks for spotting this one Benno!
*** Bug 163455 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
